alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 5:16AM PST until January 14 at 10:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST SUNDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6 to 8 feet through Sunday. Sets of 10 to 12 feet Friday and Saturday. Minor coastal flooding possible Friday and Saturday during high tide. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 10 PM PST Sunday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 10 AM Friday to 10 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Minor flooding of low lying beach areas, parking lots, and boardwalks around high tide. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide of 3.54 ft at 1210 PM Friday and 4.08 ft at 213 AM Saturday.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
